abstract: Produced by the Australian Commonwealth Film Unit in 1964, made on the Upper Sepik River in New Guinea, this film documents the role of a patrolman in this remote region.
description: Episode of Series "Australia today". Shows the duties and responsibilities of an Australian Patrol Officer in the Upper Sepik River area of New Guinea. With law and order they try to introduce education, health services, agricultural services and a wider political concept. The rugged mountains and diverse native tribes present innumerable problems - most important is to encourage them to live together peacefully.
